name: .issue
about:
A platform where experienced veterans and budding youngsters come together to express their ideas, speak their minds and to challenge their views, on the most pertinent issues that plague our society.

•  This time, .ISSUE! is back here with the theme- 'Democracy and Dissent: UAPA, Sedition and Govt. Control of OTT'

•  Newly passed amendment to Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), the age-old Sedition Act and the proposed measure to bring the OTT platforms and online news under the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting had created multiple controversies. Though a small spectrum of the population believe that it curbs incitement to revolution and proves to be the opportunity to prevent loss of life, damage to property while ensuring security and stability, the major half of the spectrum, inclusive of experts and activists claim that such laws may be misused in a contemporary democracy to curb political opposition and dissent. .ISSUE hopes to discuss these subjects left, right and centre by bringing in experts and eminent personalities to present their perspectives and have a fruitful and healthy interactive session with the young audience.

name: AlumConnect
about:
A platform to interact with and learn from some of our most renowned ex-MECians. 

     In contrast with many of its contemporaries, MEC has always showcased a very rich alumni culture. The vast variety of the many activities the college has served host to had, over the years, coaxed a strong relationship between the college and its alumni. AlumConnect was a manifestation of this bond. 

     Launched under the tagline - 
Connect | Converse  | Collaborate, this was the first initiative undertaken by Excel MEC in association with the prominent clubs at MEC (IETE, Mixed Signal, FOSS, IEEE, MUN, IEDC, BME, EBMS, ASME, EMF, MACS).

name: Digital Internship Programme
about:
Excel 2020 in collaboration with PACE LABS- IET (CET Chapter) presents the Digital Internship Program. An opportunity to learn about the trending topics of the tech industry, explained in a concise and beginner-friendly way, to help everyone out there looking to develop their skill set. 

     Want to learn more about the buzz-words in the tech industry? You’re in the right place!

     The courses will be equipped with everything necessary to make sure you’re equipped with all the right tools to enter the tech industry. 

The courses available are:
• IoT
• AI 
• Python
• Ethical Hacking
• Flutter
• AutoCAD
• AR Game Development 
• Matlab 

     The sessions will include video sessions, assignments, live interactions, and hands-on experience and can be completed at any time according to the participant's convenience. 

Benefits of the course include:
• Certificate from IET(CET Chapter).
• 20 KTU Activity Points.

Registration Fee:
•  MECians - Rs 590/-
•  Non-MEC - Rs 790/-

name: IBeTo
about: Innovations for a better tomorrow (IBeTo) is a platform by Excel 2020 in association with IEEE HAC, IEEE MEC SB and GirlsScript Kochi that strives to find unique solutions to society's biggest difficulties. IBeTo will connect revolutionary ideas with mentors to guide each project to its full potential. Our platform will help showcase the genius of young minds and how they can lend a hand to future generations

name: Kaithangu
about: As the online classes started picking up pace and the digital divide among student started getting even more pronounced, a drive was undertaken by Excel Mec in association with NSS MEC and Thanal Mec. 5 Gadgets along with donations were collected and redistributed to a few students from GHS Pulickamaly, an adopted school under Thanal.

name: Reach Out
about:
Reach Out was an initiative by EXCEL 2020 for that unfortunate faction wherein we associated with SEEDS, a non - profit organization committed to reaching out to those sectors of the society that go overlooked and unnoticed like orphanages or old age homes affected by Covid-19. 
A week-long event held from 13th to 17th May 2020, Reach Out, hosted over ten celebrities and social media influencers including Vinay Fort, Rajeev Ravi, Prapthi Elizabeth and DJ Savo. The line-up also included stand-up comedians Vikash Paul, Barath Balaji & Rahul Sridhar, musicians Arun Alat, Anthony Lazaro, Rinosh George and Imbachi, actress Anagha Maria Varghese and content creator Kuruvi.png. Eat Kochi Eat, the popular food content blog on Instagram was a part of the event too.
The event was well received by the student community of MEC and was fortunate enough to raise a whopping ₹1.5 lakh through donations and registrations.

name: SpotOn!
about:
In association with Speech Debate India, EXCEL 2020 brings to you, The TurnCoat Debate!
Get ready for the ultimate battle of wits - against yourself, of course.

     After poetry filled the air with the successful completion of the Quatrain and അക്ഷരപ്പോരാളി Competition, gear up for Phase 2 of SpotOn! 

     In association with Speech Debate India, EXCEL 2020 brings to you, The TurnCoat Debate. Get a chance to explore exciting discourse like never before, as you get to fiercely debate both for and against the topic. Brace yourself for some fun, spontaneity, and a whole lot of thinking! 

     Own the stage, speak your heart out, and stand a chance to be crowned the best debater of them all!

name: Tech Tyro
about:
Tech-tyro is an introductory program conducted in collaboration with DSC MEC to provide real-world insights into the field of engineering for school going enthusiasts of the age group 13-17. The program provides an in-depth understanding of technological evolution and at the same time clears all misconceptions that come with it.
The program is divided into three sessions- the first one focuses on the promising field of machine learning which will be followed by a session with an Ex-MECian who would throw light on the ever-escalating future of technology. The program will be concluded with an interactive session where the students get to raise queries and share their experiences.

name: Techstreak
about: Techstreak is a two-day webinar series taken by some of the leading industrial experts, wherein the industrial enthusiasts are offered an option to explore more of the options open to them in today's dynamic industry.

name: W.I.S.E
about:
WISE (Women in Science and Engineering) is a national level conference aimed at disseminating knowledge on scientific experiences and technological skills. 

      With a lineup of four incredible speakers who have dreamed beyond the barriers and kept running after the finish line, the event is curated to fuel your professional and personal development while also igniting the drive to pursue your passions!

      Our first speaker Ms Arundhati Kurup is a graduate student at the University of Southern California, Los Angeles, currently pursuing Masters in Computer Science. She has closely worked with the US Military and Intelligence on an AI tool, contributed as a software engineering intern at Qualcomm HQ with the Snapdragon 5G team, and worked as a technology fellow at Impact Labs NYC.

      With an MSc in Analytical Chemistry from the University of Calicut, our second speaker Ms Beena Sunilkumar is a Senior Scientist at the Department of Atomic Energy, who joined AMD at the young age of 22! A first ranker graduate from the University of Calicut, she is currently pursuing her PhD from Osmania University, and she specialises in the analysis of geological materials and nuclear materials.

      Our third speaker Ms Mehul Smriti Raje completed her master’s degree in Computational Science and Engineering from Harvard University, and currently works as a Software Engineer at Google! With having interned at Microsoft, Spotify, SanDisk and more, Ms Mehul is a mentor and a speaker, who supports more visibility for women in media through her writing and technical art.

      From the Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre in Trivandrum, a major centre of the ISRO, we have our next speaker, Ms. S. Nagapriya! Both a Scientist and an Engineer, she currently specializes in the Advanced Materials & Ceramic Division (AMCD).
